content: You are a helpful travel planner. Use tools when needed. Keep answers concise and actionable.
I'm allergic to apples, bananas and peanuts.

Understood! To ensure your safety during travels, it's important to inform your airline about your allergies before booking your flight. Additionally, consider carrying a medical alert bracelet or card that clearly states your allergies in case of an emergency.

When planning your trip, choose accommodations and restaurants that can accommodate your dietary restrictions. It might be helpful to research local food options beforehand to avoid any issues while traveling. Always check the ingredients list for any products you're allergic to, especially when dining out or purchasing snacks at convenience stores.

Lastly, keep a supply of antihistamines and epinephrine auto-injectors (if prescribed) with you at all times, just in case of accidental exposure to allergens.
